page.title: 05Tamar Valley _ Recreation
page.content: The offering for{tourism}in this area is the pleasure taken in sailing on the River, walking along the valley or staying in charming{holiday}cottages. Many types of boats have moorings at Weir Quay and steamers ply through with their human cargo to the upper reaches. Birdwatching is a popular pastime where rare species are often spotted along the mud-banks or amongst the hedgerows.{Recreation}tends not to be commercialsed but is rather of the individuals making. It is possible to appreciate nature and on occasions 'hear' the silence of the countryside. {Leisure}time is spent in a variety of ways, a firm favourite is going for a stroll when one can study closely the flora, fauna and well kept gardens. Any observer, artist or photographer cannot fail to be inspired by the wealth of natural and unspoilt beauty.
